title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16 ยง 229.12 - Ammonia
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16 ยง 229.12 - Ammonia

State Regulations
(a) Allowable
concentration. The gas distributed by each company shall contain not more than
five grains of ammonia per 100 cubic feet of gas volume measured at a
temperature of 60 degrees Fahrenheit and an absolute pressure of 30 inches of
mercury column. (b) Equipment, testing procedure and required tests. In each instance of evidence of or doubt
or difference of opinion regarding the presence of ammonia in the distributed
gas, each company may be required to make suitable tests therefor with suitable
equipment and a suitable testing procedure at its testing stations required by
subdivisions (a) through (d) of section
229.50
of this Part as directed by
this commission. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 16
ยง
229.12

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
